title: The sorrowfull damsels lamentation for want of a husband. This maiden sure was in a longing temper, and young men they are to blame that would venture, it is a pity any damsel she should want the help of a young man's company. This maidens fortune proves so very hard, that never a young does her no more regard: but young men hereafter be sure to have a care, they do not bring young maidens to despair. To the tune of, The country farmer.
publisher: Printed for P[hilip]. Brooksby at the Golden Ball in Pye-corner,
